author: Joshua Fluke
description:
“Forever layoffs” are the new corporate buzzword — but the truth is way darker.
Companies are quietly firing under 50 workers at a time to dodge WARN Act protections, skip severance, avoid bad press, and keep their real layoff numbers hidden. Glassdoor calls it “rolling cuts.” I call it what it is: corporate gray-area exploitation 101.

In this video, I break down how companies are now using micro-layoffs to avoid announcing anything publicly, why job security has always been an illusion, and how this “forever layoff” cycle creates constant anxiety, distrust, and churn. We also look at the data, the WARN Act loopholes, and the corporate bootlickers defending it all.

If you don’t own the company, you’re not safe — and the sooner people understand that, the better they’ll navigate today’s job market.

Watch to the end for advice on how to protect yourself, finesse the system, and stay one step ahead of corporate nonsense.
